key.item_tag.shield.tooltip.name: Shields
key.item_tag.shield.tooltip.description:
[key.item_tag.shield](Shields) are simply a different category of weapon - they function the same as big club really.
However, shields often have higher [key.mechanic.block_guard] values and usually grant some extra [key.stat.posture] and [key.stat.defense.armor] when equipped.
key.item_tag.sword.tooltip.name: Swords
key.item_tag.sword.tooltip.description: Swords are a broad category of weapons that can include shorter [key.hold_type.one_handed] weapons such as a short sword or gladius, as well as larger [key.hold_type.two_handed] weapons like a zweihander.
key.item_tag.axe.tooltip.name: Axe
key.item_tag.axe.tooltip.description: Axes are a broad category of weapons that can include small [key.hold_type.one_handed] weapons such as hatchets or larger [key.hold_type.two_handed] weapons like a war-axe.
key.item_tag.dagger.tooltip.name: Daggers
key.item_tag.dagger.tooltip.description:
Daggers are lil pointy sticks that you can stab people with.
They typically scale more with [key.stat.dexterity] than most weapons and are always [key.hold_type.one_handed].
key.item_tag.spear.tooltip.name: Spear
key.item_tag.spear.tooltip.description:
Spears a longer weapons that tend to be pointer on the end.
Can be either [key.hold_type.one_handed] or [key.hold_type.two_handed].
key.item_tag.greatsword.tooltip.name: Greatswords
key.item_tag.greatsword.tooltip.descript:
Like a [key.item_tag.sword], only [key.flavour.important](greater).
Nearly all [key.item_tag.greatsword](Greatswords) are [key.hold_type.two_handed].
key.item_tag.bow.tooltip.name: Bow
key.item_tag.bow.tooltip.description:
[key.item_tag.bow](Bows) typically fire arrows at stuff.
Sometimes they have wacky effects.
key.item_tag.longbow.tooltip.name: Longbow
key.item_tag.arrow.tooltip.name: Arrow
key.item_tag.arrow.tooltip.description:
[key.flag.physical] projectile typically fired by a [key.item_tag.bow].
Arrows will inherit the flags of whatever weapon fires them.
key.item_tag.armor.tooltip.name: Armor
key.item_tag.armor.tooltip.description: [key.item_tag.armor] is any equipment that goes into your head, chest, arm and leg slots.
key.item_tag.flask.tooltip.name: Flask
key.item_tag.flask.tooltip.description:
You start each run with a [key.item_tag.flask] full [key.stat.flask_charges].
You can drink from your [key.item_tag.flask] by pressing [key.control.quick_heal].
Each classes starting [key.item_tag.flask] is unique, though they will almost always restore some [key.stat.health] or [key.stat.magic.mana] (or sometimes both).
You can find more unique [key.item_tag.flask](Flasks) deeper in the [key.flavour.dungeon].
key.item_tag.clothing.tooltip.name: Clothing (Tag)
key.item_tag.clothing.tooltip.descriptio:
[key.item_tag.clothing] is used for [key.item_tag.armor] that has no inherent defensive capabilities.
Instead, [key.item_tag.clothing] must source its usefulness from other places, such as [key.flag.enchanted](Enchantments).
key.item_tag.light.tooltip.name: Light (Tag)
key.item_tag.light.tooltip.description:
[key.item_tag.light] items weigh less than other items in their category and tend to represent sleeker designs.
The [key.item_tag.light] tag has no intrinsic effect.
key.item_tag.medium.tooltip.name: Medium (Tag)
key.item_tag.medium.tooltip.description:
[key.item_tag.medium] items offer a blend of the benefits between [key.item_tag.heavy] and [key.item_tag.light]
.The [key.item_tag.medium] tag has no intrinsic effect.
key.item_tag.heavy.tooltip.name: Heavy (Tag)
key.item_tag.heavy.tooltip.description:
[key.item_tag.heavy] items weigh more than other items in their category and represent items that have prioritised bulk and weight over the comfort of the user.
The [key.item_tag.heavy] tag has no intrinsic effect.
key.item_tag.peasant.tooltip.name: Peasant (Tag)
key.item_tag.peasant.tooltip.description:
[key.item_tag.peasant] items represent things that one might find on a humble farmstead.
Ofcourse, the Dungeon is not a suitable place for such quaint things...
key.item_tag.starting.tooltip.name: Starter (Tag)
key.item_tag.starting.tooltip.descriptio: A player started the run with this item.
key.item_tag.metal.tooltip.name: Metal (Tag)
key.item_tag.metal.tooltip.description:
This item is composed largely of metal.
The [key.item_tag.metal] tag has no intrinsic effect.
key.item_tag.melee.tooltip.name: Melee (Tag)
key.item_tag.melee.tooltip.description: This item can be used as a [key.flag.melee] weapon.
key.item_tag.ranged.tooltip.name: Ranged (Tag)
key.item_tag.ranged.tooltip.description: This item can be used as a [key.flag.ranged] weapon.
key.item_tag.onehanded.tooltip.name: One-Handed (Tag)
key.item_tag.twohanded.tooltip.name: Two-Handed (Tag)
key.item_tag.improvised.tooltip.name: Improvised (Tag)
key.item_tag.improvised.tooltip.descript:
This weapon is comprised of in whole or in part, improvised parts.
It requires no special training to use correctly and likely isn't as effective as a properly made weapon.
[key.flavour.negative](Proficiency system has not yet been implemented. Sorry!)
key.item_tag.simple.tooltip.name: Simple (Tag)
key.item_tag.simple.tooltip.description:
This weapon is simply made and easy to understand.
It requires no special training to use correctly.
[key.flavour.negative](Proficiency system has not yet been implemented. Sorry!).
key.item_tag.martial.tooltip.name: Martial (Tag)
key.item_tag.martial.tooltip.description:
This weapon is crafted for martial combat and requires a degree of expertise to use correctly.
[key.flavour.negative](Proficiency system has not yet been implemented. Sorry!).
key.item_tag.exotic.tooltip.name: Exotic (Tag)
key.item_tag.exotic.tooltip.description:
This item is of unusual make - it's elaborate, unique in some way that makes it hard to use.
Requires mastery of the trade to use correctly.
[key.flavour.negative](Proficiency system has not yet been implemented. Sorry!).
key.item_tag.ultra.tooltip.name: Ultra (Big Sword)
key.item_tag.ultra.tooltip.description: It's fuckin [key.flavour.important](ULTRA) baybeeee. we got that [key.item_tag.big_sword](BIG) sword
key.item_tag.big_sword.tooltip.name: Big (Quite Large)
key.item_tag.big_sword_part_2.tooltip.na: GARGANTUAN (like seriously tho it's too big like it looks unserious being that big
key.item_tag.big_sword_part_2.tooltip.de:
like we're talkin' huge. this thing has to be like 3 meters long, i don't even really know how you make something like this.
how does guts use it anyway, that just seems silly. like 'ooo im so cool i use this big fucking sword'
sorry i shouldn't say that you might want to use the big sword,that's ok you're allowed to do that i wont make fun of you.
i promise i made the sword so its ok you have my blessing. go forth and smite every poor skeleton you see
key.item_tag.str.tooltip.name: Strength (Tag)
key.item_tag.str.tooltip.description: This weapon scales off of your [key.stat.strength].
key.item_tag.dex.tooltip.name: Dexterity (Tag)
key.item_tag.dex.tooltip.description: This weapon scales off of your [key.stat.dexterity].
key.item_tag.heal.tooltip.name: Healing (Tag)
key.item_tag.heal.tooltip.description: This item is capable of [key.flag.healing](Healing) you.
key.item_tag.buff.tooltip.name: Buff (Tag)
key.item_tag.buff.tooltip.description: This item will give you a beneficial [key.flag.buff] when used.
key.item_tag.potion.tooltip.name: Potion (Tag)
key.item_tag.potion.tooltip.description:
This item is a [key.item_tag.potion].
[key.item_tag.potion](Potions) can be found all throughout the Dungeon and have a wide variety of effects when ingested.
key.item_tag.minor.tooltip.name: Minor (Tag)
key.item_tag.minor.tooltip.description: This item is a [key.item_tag.minor] item, meaing it is only weakly imbued with magic.
